text:
Pet 1.5 l, Gift from Brno Czech Rep.
Ciemnomiedziane piwo z jasnobeżową, puszystą pianą oraz słodowym, karmelowym, lekko drzewnym aromatem. W smaku pełen, słodowe i karmelowe z lekko przypalaną, drzewną goryczką na finiszu.

On tap. Amber body, lasting light beige head. Aroma of bread, grains, toast and some floral hops. Taste of caramel, toast, grain, nutmeg, roasted malts and floral hops. Good beer, only that the roasted character is a bit harsh.

(tap 0,5l @ Pegas Jiráskova (Brno))
Aroma: Very light sweet, malty.
Appearance: Clear dark amber color. Huge, beige head.
Taste: Medium sweet, fruity alcoholic.
Palate: Medium body. Sticky texture. Astringent, light warm finish.
Overall: Average, nothing special.

0,4l draught. Classical half-brown beer with rocky head what doesnt disappear. Taste is quite simple, nice sweet malt, smoky (earthy) hop, and a lot of caramel thanks to the caramel malt. CO2 is ligh (it is OK for me)t, but foam is very right - i dont understand. :)

Vycap Richtar Jakub. Tmavsia jantarova farba, jemne kremova pena. Vona prazenych sladov, karamelu a jemne oriesky. V chuti dost citit alkohol, menej prazene slady, karamel a horku kavu. Stredne telo, osviezujuce.
<Tap at brewpub Amber color with thick off-white head. Roasted malt, caramel in aroma. Caramel malt, herbs, alcoholic bitterness in taste.

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Légère odeur de céréale. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de céréale et de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement sucré. (Rating #4846)
On tap in brewpub. Pours hazy dark copper color with white head. Aroma is fruity and sweet, hint of honey. Taste is sweet, honey and some yeast. Medium body.

On tap at the brewpub (04/03/13). Clear dark gold pour topped by a thin white head. Aroma is really booze froward, pretty aggressive and aggravating, estery, pineapple-booze, not particularly inviting. Grainy as in grain alcohol flavour, pineapple, really fruity, a tad cloying. Palate is well carbed that manages to cut through some of the sweetness, but it is still quite unpleasant.

My Bottom Line:
Floral hops and svelte caramel malts lean on alcohol and wooden hop bitterness in this storyless, unpolished lager.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam tops the misty amber.
-Carbonation was soft and the body slender, which normally would have helped drinkability.
-Fruity edges are found.
-Another disappointing offering from Pegas. Tastes like this brewery is on auto-pilot, living off of tourists and business people staying at the hotel. There are many better places in Brno...

On tap at the brewpub.
Nebolo to zlé, ale mohlo to být lepí. Chuťově výrazné, ale jedno stačilo. Točené v pegasu na české.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, light spice and light acidic. Flavour is caramel, grass, pine and light DMS.
Keg at Pegas. Pours Amber with a foamy white head. Sweet caramel. Some hops. Nice Co2 prickle. Good body. Pretty nice.
1.5l bottle. Not bad at all. Longer you drink it - better tastes. Dark brown color, big head.

On tap at brewery restaurant. Slightly hazy deep copper colour. Medium creamy beige head. Aroma of honey, caramel, grassy hops, spicy (cinnamon?). Taste medium to heavy sweet, light to medium bitter. Light bitter, light sweet finish.
on tap at the brewery. clear rich golden, sparkling with a bold head; honeyed hay aroma; simple and clean with some golden syrup and a tinny bitter finish

From tap in Brno, amber coloured with some darker foamy white head. Smell: some alcohol, woody, oaky, whisky alike smell. Taste: malty, yeasty, oaky, chestnuts, whiskey. Perfect beer to drink in a nice pub all day long.
Draught at the brewpub: Aroma with caramel, malt and some yeast. Amber color, foamy head. Flavor is mainly malty, hints of alcohol, full bodied, some caramel and fruit notes. Quite plane.
ambrata buona schiuma piuttosto persitente naso leggermente tostato caramello disceto malto un po di luppolo un tocco fruttato erbaceo in bocca discreto corpo un buon amaro erbaceo

Draught at the brewpub into a 2000ml siphon and taked away, tasted at home.Deep hazy amber colored one with a fine creamy tan/off white head that diminishes slowly with nice lace on the glass. Earthy malt based flavor with some fruity floral hop in the start, some caramel, honey, fruits. Smooth, well rounded mouthfeel, fine cellar taste with malt, fruity fig and honey on the palate, nice bit of flowery and fruity hop in the finish. Nice brew.
Draught at the brewpub on May 18, 2009Hazy copper color, small white head. Sweet, sugary, malty, caramel scent. Malty, sweet, full taste. Medium to moussy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
Draught at Minipivovar Pegas, Brno. August 08. Pours amber with a lasting white head. Aroma and taste of sweet malt and grassy hop bitterness. Not sure about this one, an unbalanced beer.

Draught at the brewpub: In comparison to its name quite amber coloured with a slowly collapsing off-white head; traces of vinegar in the sweet-malty and toasted-malty nose; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, quite gassy, quite light bodied for a beer of 16°; traces of dried fruits (raisins) in the average sweet-malty and slightly bitter finish. Quite a boring brew.....

Slightly hazy amber color, good off-white head. Slightly caramelly, mostly malty aroma. Caramelly, sweetish with medium carbonation. Some distant notes of grassy hops and alcohol. Nice caramelly, alcoholic aftertaste. Neutral but drinkable.
